meanings.definition: To move or remove with a shovel.
meanings.sent1: She shovelled the snow from the driveway.
meanings.sent2: He shovelled the dirt into a pile.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shovelled the nuts into its cheeks.
meanings.sent4: The workers shovelled the debris out of the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The child shovelled sand into the bucket with glee.

meanings.definition: To dig or excavate with a shovel.
meanings.sent1: They shovelled a hole in the ground for the plant.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist shovelled carefully to uncover the artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The dog shovelled up the bone it buried last week.
meanings.sent4: The miners shovelled through the earth to find precious gems.
meanings.sent5: She shovelled through the snow to find her lost keys.
